alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 13 at 4:22PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Colorado, including the following county, Larimer. This includes western portions of the Cameron Peak burn area. * WHEN...Until 615 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 422 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Up to 0.4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Laramie River, Two and One Half Creek, Brinker Creek, Joe Wright Creek, North Fork Joe Wright Creek, Cache La Poudre River, Michigan River, North Fork West Branch Laramie River, Roaring Creek, Sheep Creek and Poudre Pass Creek, La. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of West Central Larimer County - This includes the following additional locations... The Upper Poudre Canyon, The Laramie River Road near Chambers Lake, Long Draw Road and Remote areas in the Cameron Peak Wilderness.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Heavy Rainfall will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads and roadside culverts in the affected part of the Cameron Peak burn area. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows.
